en: When Mr. Lorry had finished his breakfast, he went out for a stroll on the beach. The little narrow, crooked town of Dover hid itself away from the beach, and ran its head into the chalk cliffs, like a marine ostrich. The beach was a desert of heaps of sea and stones tumbling wildly about, and the sea did what it liked, and what it liked was destruction. It thundered at the town, and thundered at the cliffs, and brought the coast down, madly. The air among the houses was of so strong a piscatory flavour that one might have supposed sick fish went up to be dipped in it, as sick people went down to be dipped in the sea. A little fishing was done in the port, and a quantity of strolling about by night, and looking seaward: particularly at those times when the tide made, and was near flood. Small tradesmen, who did no business whatever, sometimes unaccountably realised large fortunes, and it was remarkable that nobody in the neighbourhood could endure a lamplighter.

Casi de continuo rugÃ­a contra la ciudad, bramaba contra los farallones, embestÃ­a contra los peÃ±ascos que pretendÃ­an oponerse a su paso y los derribaba con estruendo. RespirÃ¡base en las casas un olor tan fuerte a pescado, que no parecÃ­a sino que los habitantes de las aguas salÃ­an de Ã©stas para curar en las casas sus enfermedades, de la misma manera que las personas enfermas suelen buscar la salud en los baÃ±os de mar. Comerciantes insignificantes a los que nunca se veÃ­a hacer un negocio, realizaban de pronto fortunas inmensas que no tenÃ­an explicaciÃ³n racional, y era muy de notar que nadie, por aquellos lugares, podÃ­a sufrir la presencia de una luz, de la que huÃ­an como del demonio.

st: Ha a qeta ho ja lijo tsa hoseng, o ile a ea lebÅpong la leoatle. Motse o moqotetsane o moqotetsane, o khopameng oa Dover o ipata hole le lebopong, 'me oa mathela hloohong ea eona ka har'a mafika a chalk, joalo ka ostrich ea leoatle. Lebopo le ne le le lehoatata la liqubu tsa leoatle le majoe a korotla ka mokhoa o makatsang, 'me leoatle la etsa seo le se ratang, le seo le se ratang e ne e le timetso. E ile ea utloahala motseng, 'me ea utloahala ka mafika, 'me ea tlisa lebopong, ka bohlanya. Moea har'a matlo o ne o le matla haholo tatso ea piscatory hoo motho a ka beng a nahana hore tlhapi e kulang e ile ea nyoloha ho kenngoa ho eona, ha batho ba kulang ba theohetse ho kenngoa ka leoatleng. Ho tÅ¡oasa litlhapi hanyane ho ne ho etsoa koung, 'me bongata ba ho tsamaea hoo e ka bang bosiu, le ho sheba leoatleng: haholo-holo linakong tseo ha leqhubu le entsoe, 'me e ne e le haufi le moroallo. Bahoebi ba banyenyane, ba neng ba sa etse khoebo eng kapa eng, ka linako tse ling ba ne ba sa hlokomele maruo a maholo, 'me ho ne ho makatsa hore ha ho motho ea ka mamellang lebone.

tn: Fa a sena go ja dijo tsa sefitlholo, o ne a ya go ya go ja dijo tsa motshegare. Motse o monnye o o pitlaganeng, o o kgopang o ne wa iphitlha go tswa mo lotshitshing lwa lewatle, o ne wa tabogela mo ditshimong tsa chalk, jaaka ostrich ya lewatle. Lebopo e ne e le sekaka sa diqubu tsa lewatle le majwe, mme lewatle la etsa seo le se ratang, le seo le se ratang e ne e le tshenyo. E ne ya duma mo motseng, mme ya duma mo ditshimong, ya ba ya kwa godimo, ya ba ya kwa godimo, ya ba ya kwa godimo. Phefo mo matlong e ne e na le tatso e e nonofileng thata mo e ka nnang gore tlhapi e e lwalang e ne ya tlhatloga go tsena mo go yona, fa batho ba ba lwalang ba ne ba fologa go inaa mo lewatleng. Go ne go na le lefelo le lennye le le neng le le mo lewatleng le le neng le le mo lewatleng le le neng le tsamaya bosigo, mme ka dinako tse dingwe go ne go na le komelelo e e neng e le gaufi le morwalela. Ka dinako tse dingwe batho ba ba neng ba sa kgone go dira dilo dingwe, ba ne ba sa kgone go dira dilo tse dintsi mme ba ne ba sa kgone go bona gore go ne go se na ope yo o ka kgonang go itshokela lesedi le le kwa godimo.

mg: Rehefa vita ny sakafo maraina nataon'Atoa Lorry dia nivoaka izy mba handehandeha eny amoron-dranomasina. Niafina lavitra ny torapasika ilay tanÃ na kely tery sy mikitoantoana ao Dover, ary nihazakazaka nankany amin'ny hantsam - bato, toy ny aotirisy. Ny tora-pasika dia tany efitra feno ranomasina sy vato mirodana be, ary nanao izay tiany ny ranomasina, ary ny zavatra tiany dia ny fandringanana. Dia nikotrokotroka tao an-tanÃ na izy, ary nikotrokotroka teny amin'ny harambato, ary nampietry ny morontsiraka tamin'ny fahaverezan-tsaina. Ny rivotra tao anatin'ireo trano dia tena mafy tokoa ny tsiron'ny piscatory ka mety ho nisy olona iray noheverina ho trondro marary niakatra mba ho arotsaka ao anatiny, satria nidina ny marary mba ho arotsaka any an-dranomasina. Nisy jono kely natao tao amin'ny seranan-tsambo, ary be dia be ny mandehandeha amin'ny alina, ary mijery seaward: indrindra fa tamin'ireo fotoana izay nanaovana ny ranomasina, ary efa akaiky ny tondra-drano. Ireo mpivarotra madinika, izay tsy nanao raharaham-barotra na inona na inona, indraindray dia nahatsapa harena be, ary tena niavaka fa tsy nisy olona teo amin'ny manodidina afaka niaritra jiro.

en: Madame Defarge, his wife, sat in the shop behind the counter as he came in. Madame Defarge was a stout woman of about his own age, with a watchful eye that seldom seemed to look at anything, a large hand heavily ringed, a steady face, strong features, and great composure of manner. There was a character about Madame Defarge, from which one might have predicated that she did not often make mistakes against herself in any of the reckonings over which she presided. Madame Defarge being sensitive to cold, was wrapped in fur, and had a quantity of bright shawl twined about her head, though not to the concealment of her large earrings. Her knitting was before her, but she had laid it down to pick her teeth with a toothpick. Thus engaged, with her right elbow supported by her left hand, Madame Defarge said nothing when her lord came in, but coughed just one grain of cough. This, in combination with the lifting of her darkly defined eyebrows over her toothpick by the breadth of a line, suggested to her husband that he would do well to look round the shop among the customers, for any new customer who had dropped in while he stepped over the way.

Una de las caracterÃ­sticas de la seÃ±ora Defarge consistÃ­a en no sufrir nunca equivocaciones que redundasen en perjuicio de sus intereses en ninguna de las operaciones del establecimiento. Extremadamente sensible al frÃ­o, iba envuelta en pieles y abrigaba su cabeza con un chal de colores chillones que la cubrÃ­a por completo, bien que dejando a la vista los grandes pendientes que adornaban sus orejas. TenÃ­a frente a sÃ­ su calceta, pero la habÃ­a dejado sobre el mostrador para consagrar algunos minutos a la limpieza de su dentadura, lo que estaba haciendo con un mondadientes. Absorta en su ocupaciÃ³n, con el codo derecho apoyado sobre la mano izquierda, nada dijo la seÃ±ora Defarge cuando su marido entrÃ³ en el establecimiento, pero dejÃ³ oir una tosecita apenas perceptible. La tosecita, combinada con un ligero enarcamiento de sus cejas, negras como el ala del cuervo y perfectamente arqueadas, diÃ³ a entender a su marido la conveniencia de dar un vistazo a los clientes, entre los cuales acaso encontrase alguno nuevo que habÃ­a llegado a la taberna mientras se encontraba en la calle.

st: Mofumahali Defarge, mosali oa hae, o ile a lula ka lebenkeleng kamora khaontara ha a kena. Mofumahali Defarge e ne e le mosali ea ka bang lilemo tsa hae, a nang le leihlo le shebileng hangata le neng le bonahala eka ke ntho leha e le efe, letsoho le leholo le lesale haholo, sefahleho se tsitsitseng, likarolo tse matla le sebopeho se seholo. Ho ne ho e-na le semelo sa Mofumahali Defarge, eo ho eona motho a ka beng a hlokometse hore hangata ha aa ka a etsa liphoso khahlanong le efe kapa efe ea batÅ¡oaruoa eo a e nkang. Madame Defarge o ne a le hlokolosi ho serame, o phuthetsoe ka boea, 'me o ne a e-na le liaparo tse ngata tse khanyang tse koahetsoeng ka hlooho ea hae, leha e se ho ipata ha masale a hae a maholo. O ne a le ka pele ho eena, empa o ne a e behile hore a tle a nke meno a hae ka leino. 'Me ha aa ka a bua ka letsoho la hae le letona, Monghali Defarge o ile a re letho ha mong'a hae a kena, empa a khohlela e le 'ngoe feela ea khohlela e le' ngoe ea khohlela. Sena, hammoho le ho phahamisa mahlo a hae a hlakileng ka ho fetesisa ka leino la hae ka bophara ba mohala, o ile a fana ka tlhahiso ho monna oa hae hore o tla etsa hantle ho sheba lebenkele har'a bareki, bakeng sa moreki ofe kapa ofe e mocha ea neng a theohile ha a ntse a kenella tseleng.

tn: Mosadi wa gagwe e bong Defarge, o ne a nna mo lebenkeleng le le fa tlase ga ntlo fa a ntse a tsena. Mme Defarge e ne e le mosadi wa dingwaga tse di ka nnang dingwaga tsa gagwe, a na le leitlho le le matlho a a neng a lebega a lebile sengwe le sengwe, seatla se segolo thata, sefatlhego se se tiileng, se se nonofileng le se se nang le sebopego se segolo. Go ne go na le semelo sa ga Mme Defarge, se se ka tswang se dirile gore gantsi a se ka a dira diphoso mo go ene. Mme Defarge o ne a le mo bogaleng, o ne a apere diaparo tse dintsi tse di neng di le ka fa gare ga tlhogo ya gagwe, le fa e se go iphitlha ka dikuku tsa gagwe tse dikgolo. O ne a le fa pele ga gagwe, mme o ne a e baya fa fatshe go mo tshameka meno. Ka go dira jalo, o ne a le mo letsogong le le jang la molema, Mme Defarge o ne a sa itse sepe fa mong wa gagwe a tsena, mme o ne a gotlhola nyana fela. O ne a tlhalosa fa monna wa gagwe a ne a le mo tseleng e e neng e le mo go yone, o ne a tlhalosa fa a ne a le mo tseleng e e neng e le mo go yone, a re o tla dira sentle gore a lebelele lebenkele la bareki, ka gonne moreki mongwe le mongwe yo mosha yo o neng a le mo tseleng o ne a le mo tseleng.

ty: Te parahi ra o Madame Defarge, ta'na vahine, i roto i te fare toa i muri mai i te vahi aufauraa, a tomo mai ai oia. E vahine itoito o Madame Defarge fatata hoÃª Ã¢ to'na matahiti, e te hoÃª mata haapa'o maitai e au ra e mea varavara roa i te hi'o i te hoÃª noa'e mea, te hoÃª rima rahi tei taamuhia i ni'a i te rima, te hoÃª hoho'a mata papÃ», te mau hoho'a mata puai, e te mata ataata rahi. Te vai ra te hoÃª huru i roto i te Madame Defarge, e no reira, ua mana'o te hoÃª taata e, aita oia i rave pinepine i te hape i ni'a ia'na iho i roto i te mau haavaraa ta'na i peresideni. No te toetoe rahi o Madame Defarge, ua puohuhia oia i te huruhuru animala, e e rave rahi ahu anaana tei taamuhia i nia i to ' na upoo, noa ' tu e e ere i te mea moe roa. Tei mua ia ' na to ' na niho, tera rÃ¢, ua tuu oia i te reira i raro no te ohi i to ' na niho e te hoÃª niho haavare. No reira, ma te tape'a i to'na rima atau i ni'a i to'na rima aui, aita o Madame Defarge i parau noa a'e i te taime a tomo mai ai to'na fatu, tera rÃ¢, ua hota noa oia. mg: Nipetraka tao amin'ny fivarotana tao ambadiky ny latabatra i Madame Defarge, vadiny, rehefa niditra izy. Vehivavy mahery fo tamin'ny taonany i Madame Defarge, izay nanana maso feno fiambenana izay toa tsy dia nijery na inona na inona, tanana lehibe iray izay nanakoako be, endrika tsy miovaova, toetra matanjaka, ary fahatoniana lehibe tamin'ny fomba amam-panao. Nisy olona iray momba an'i Madame Defarge, izay mety ho nifototra fa tsy nanao fahadisoana matetika tamin'ny tenany izy tamin'ny fanisana izay nitarihany. Madame Defarge dia mora tohina amin'ny hatsiaka, nofonosina volon-damba, ary nanana shawl mamirapiratra be dia be niraikitra teo amin'ny lohany, na dia tsy nanafina ny kavina lehibeny aza. Teo anoloany ny kodiarany, saingy napetrany izany mba haka ny nifiny tamin'ny alalan'ny borosy nify. Noho izany dia nirotsaka an-tsehatra, niaraka tamin'ny kihony havanana notohanan'ny tanany havia, tsy niteny na inona na inona i Madame Defarge rehefa niditra ny tompony, fa nikohaka voan-kohaka iray monja. Izany, miaraka amin'ny fanesorana ny volomasony maizina voafaritra eo ambonin'ny nify amin'ny alalan'ny sakany amin'ny tsipika iray, dia nanolo-kevitra ny vadiny fa tsara raha mijery ny manodidina ny fivarotana eo amin'ireo mpanjifa izy, ho an'ireo mpanjifa vaovao izay nidina raha mbola nandeha teny an-dalana izy.

en: Although the Doctorâ€™s daughter had known nothing of the country of her birth, she appeared to have innately derived from it that ability to make much of little means, which is one of its most useful and most agreeable characteristics. Simple as the furniture was, it was set off by so many little adornments, of no value but for their taste and fancy, that its effect was delightful. The disposition of everything in the rooms, from the largest object to the least; the arrangement of colours, the elegant variety and contrast obtained by thrift in trifles, by delicate hands, clear eyes, and good sense; were at once so pleasant in themselves, and so expressive of their originator, that, as Mr. Lorry stood looking about him, the very chairs and tables seemed to ask him, with something of that peculiar expression which he knew so well by this time, whether he approved?

st: Le hoja morali oa Ngaka a ne a sa tsebe letho ka naha ea tsoalo ea hae, o ile a bonahala eka o tsoa ho eona bokhoni ba ho etsa mekhoa e mengata e fokolang, e leng e 'ngoe ea litÅ¡obotsi tsa eona tse thusang le tse lumellanang haholo. E bonolo joalo ka ha thepa ea ka tlung e ne e le, e behiloe ke mekhabiso e mengata e nyane, ea boleng empa e le tatso ea bona le majabajaba, hore phello ea eona e ne e le monate. ho tlosoa ha ntho e 'ngoe le e' ngoe ka likamoreng, ho tloha nthong e kholo ho isa bonyaneng; tlhophiso ea mebala, mefuta e sa tÅ¡oaneng le phapang e fumanoang ke thrift ka trifles, ka matsoho a thata, mahlo a hlakileng, le kutloisiso e ntle; Hang-hang ba ne ba le monate ho bona, 'me ho hlakile ka moqapi oa bona, hore, joalo ka ha Monghali Lorry a ne a eme a mo shebile, litulo le litafole li bonahala li mo botsa, ka ho hong ho polelo eo a neng a e tseba hantle ka nako ena, hore na o ile a lumela?

tn: "Ngaka Manette, ka gale a itse seno, ka gale a mmona le wena ka lesedi le le itshepisitsweng ka ga gago, ke na le go tsalwa, fa fela go ne go ntse go le mo sebopegong sa motho go se dira. en: Sydney had been working double tides that night, and the night before, and the night before that, and a good many nights in succession, making a grand clearance among Mr. Stryverâ€™s papers before the setting in of the long vacation. The clearance was effected at last; the Stryver arrears were handsomely fetched up; everything was got rid of until November should come with its fogs atmospheric, and fogs legal, and bring grist to the mill again.

* The passage mentions a character named Stryver, which is a surname that appears in "A Tale of Two Cities".

en: â€œNo it doesnâ€™t; I assure you it doesnâ€™t. Having supposed that there was sense where there is no sense, and a laudable ambition where there is not a laudable ambition, I am well out of my mistake, and no harm is done. Young women have committed similar follies often before, and have repented them in poverty and obscurity often before. In an unselfish aspect, I am sorry that the thing is dropped, because it would have been a bad thing for me in a worldly point of view; in a selfish aspect, I am glad that the thing has dropped, because it would have been a bad thing for me in a worldly point of viewâ€”it is hardly necessary to say I could have gained nothing by it. There is no harm at all done. I have not proposed to the young lady, and, between ourselves, I am by no means certain, on reflection, that I ever should have committed myself to that extent. Mr. Lorry, you cannot control the mincing vanities and giddinesses of empty-headed girls; you must not expect to do it, or you will always be disappointed. Now, pray say no more about it. I tell you, I regret it on account of others, but I am satisfied on my own account. And I am really very much obliged to you for allowing me to sound you, and for giving me your advice; you know the young lady better than I do; you were right, it never would have done.â€

st: Che ho joalo; Kea u tiisetsa hore ha ho joalo. Ha ke ne ke nahana hore ho na le moelelo moo ho neng ho se na kelello, le takatso e ntle moo ho se nang takatso e matla, ke tsoa liphosong tsa ka, 'me ha ho na kotsi e etsoang. Basali ba bacha ba entse booatla bo tÅ¡oanang hangata pele, 'me ba ba bake ka bofuma le botÅ¡o hangata pele. Ke masoabi hore ntho eo e se nang boithati, ke masoabi hore ntho eo e theohile, hobane e ka be e bile ntho e mpe ho nna ponong ea lefats'e; Ke thabile hore ebe ntho eo e ile ea ntÅ¡oa, hobane e ka be e le ntho e mpe ho nna ka pono ea lefats'e ka bophara, ho sa hlokahale hore ke bolele hore nka be ke sa fumane letho ka eona. Ha ho na ntho e utloisang bohloko ho hang. Ha ke e-s'o etse tlhahiso ho mofumahali e monyane, 'me, har'a rona, ha ke na bonnete, ka ho nahanisisa, hore ke kile ka itlama ho isa tekanyong eo. Dr. Loer, o ke ke oa laola li-vanities tsa mincing le li-giddinesses tsa banana ba se nang letho; Ha ua lokela ho lebella ho e etsa, kapa u tla lula u soetseha. Joale, rapela hore u se ke ua hlola u e-ba teng. Kea u joetsa, ke ikoahlaela ka lebaka la ba bang, empa ke khotsofetse ka akhaonto ea ka. 'Me ke tlamehile haholo ho uena ka ho ntumella hore ke u lle, le ho mpha likeletso tsa hau; U tseba mofumahali ea molemo ho feta eo ke e etsang; O nepile, ha ho mohla a kileng a etsa joalo. "

tn: si, ya lo se; Ke a lo tshepisa gore ga lo kitla lo dira jalo. Fa ke ne ke akanya gore go ne go na le sengwe se se sa siamang se se sa siamang, ke ne ke sa kgone go dira diphoso tse di sa siamang, mme ga go na sepe se se ka dirang gore ke se ka dira sepe. Basadi ba baÅ¡wa ba ne ba dira bosilo jo bo tshwanang gantsi pele, mme ba ba ikwatlhaela mo khumanegong le mo khumanegong gantsi pele. Ke maswabi go bo ke ile ka fitlhela go le thata ka gonne e ne e le selo se se sa siamang mo lefatsheng lotlhe; Ke ne ke itumetse thata fa ke ne ke sa kgone go dira jalo, ka gonne ke ne ke sa batle go dira dilo tse di bosula mo lefatsheng lotlhe, go ka bo go sa tlhokege gore ke kgone go dira jalo. Le fa go ntse jalo, ga go na sepe se se sa siamang. Ga ke ise ke bue ka mosadi yo o rileng, e bile ga ke a tshwanela go nna le maikutlo a gore ke ne ke tshwanetse go nna le maikutlo a a ntseng jalo. O ka se kgone go laola di-minicing le di-giddinesses tsa basetsana ba ba se nang sepe; Ga o a tshwanela go lebelela gore o tla nna o kgobegile marapo, go seng jalo o tla nna o kgobegile marapo. Dithapelo tse dingwe di re bolelela gore o se ka wa tlhola o bua gape. Ke a go bolelela gore ke maswabi ka batho ba bangwe, mme ke kgotsofalela tsela e ke akanyang ka yone. 10Ke tla go thusa thata, ka ntlha ya gore ke go utlwele botlhoko, ke go naya kgakololo ya gago; "O itse sekgowa go na le sengwe se nka se dirang. mg: "Tsia; Manome toky anao aho fa tsy izany. Rehefa nihevitra aho fa misy dikany ny hoe tsy misy dikany, ary faniriana mendri-piderana raha tsy misy faniriana mendri-piderana, dia tena miala amin'ny fahadisoako aho, ary tsy misy ratsy atao. Efa nanao hadalana toy izany matetika ny zatovovavy teo aloha ary nibebaka matetika tao anatin'ny fahantrana sy ny haizina teo aloha. Amin'ny lafiny iray tsy tia tena, miala tsiny aho fa nalatsaka ilay zavatra, satria mety ho zavatra ratsy ho ahy izany raha jerena amin'ny fomba fijerin'izao tontolo izao; Amin'ny lafiny iray feno fitiavan-tena, faly aho fa nihena ilay zavatra, satria mety ho zavatra ratsy ho ahy izany raha ny fomba fijerin'izao tontolo izao no jerenaâ€”sarotra ny milaza fa tsy afaka nahazo na inona na inona tamin'izany aho. Tsy misy voka-dratsy mihitsy atao. Tsy nanolo-kevitra tamin'ilay tovovavy aho, ary, eo amin'ny tenantsika, tsy azo antoka mihitsy aho, amin'ny fisaintsainana, fa tokony ho nanolo-tena tamin'izany fomba izany aho. Andriamatoa Lorry, tsy afaka mifehy ny zava-poana sy ny hadalan'ireo ankizivavy tsy misy loha ianao; Tsy tokony hanantena ny hanao izany ianao, raha tsy izany dia ho diso fanantenana foana. Mivavaha mba tsy hiteny intsony momba izany. Lazaiko aminareo fa manenina aho noho ny amin'ny sasany; fa izaho dia afa-po amin'ny tenako. Ary tena adidy lehibe aminao tokoa aho noho ny namelany ahy hampaneno anao sy hanome torohevitra ahy; Fantatrareo tsara kokoa noho izaho ilay tovovavy; Marina ny anao, tsy ho nanao izany mihitsy ianao."

Games at cards languished, players at dominoes musingly built towers with them, drinkers drew figures on the tables with spilt drops of wine, Madame Defarge herself picked out the pattern on her sleeve with her toothpick, and saw and heard something inaudible and invisible a long way off.

Lipapali ka likarete languished, libapali ka dominoes musingly haha litora le bona, drinkers hula lipalo litafole le spilt marotholi a veine, Madame Defarge ka boeena o ile a nka mohlala ka sleeve hae le meno a hae, 'me a bona le utloa ntho e' ngoe inaudible le sa bonahaleng tsela e telele theoha.

tn: Kgatlhego e e emisiwang le go se nne le tlhaloganyo e e anameng, gongwe e ne e bonwa ke ditlhola tse di neng di lebile mo lebenkeleng la beine, fa di ntse di lebile kwa mafelong otlhe, kwa godimo le kwa tlase, go simolola ka ntlo ya kgosi go ya kwa ga ga senokwane. Metshameko kwa dikaratang e ne ya rerega, batshameki kwa dominoes musings built towers with them, drinkers drew figures on the tables with spilt drops of wine, Mme Defarge ka boene o ne a tsaya paterone mo sefikeng sa gagwe ka meno a gagwe, a bona mme a utlwa sengwe se se sa fitlhegeng le se se sa bonaleng sekgala se seleele.

en: The spy, well used to his business, did not change his unconscious attitude, but drained his little glass of cognac, took a sip of fresh water, and asked for another glass of cognac. Madame Defarge poured it out for him, took to her knitting again, and hummed a little song over it.

en: That time passed, and her little Lucie lay on her bosom. Then, among the advancing echoes, there was the tread of her tiny feet and the sound of her prattling words. Let greater echoes resound as they would, the young mother at the cradle side could always hear those coming. They came, and the shady house was sunny with a childâ€™s laugh, and the Divine friend of children, to whom in her trouble she had confided hers, seemed to take her child in his arms, as He took the child of old, and made it a sacred joy to her.

tn: Ka yona nako eo, mo nakong eo, Lusifa o ne a robetse ka mosing wa gagwe. Morago ga moo, go ne go na le modumo wa dinao tsa gagwe tse di potlana le modumo wa mafoko a gagwe a a kwa morago. Fa ba le koo, ba ne ba ka nna ba utlwa gore go na le batho ba ba neng ba le gaufi le bone, ba ne ba tla reetsa ba ba neng ba le gaufi le bone. Ba ne ba tla, mme ntlo ya shady e ne e le letsatsi ka ditshego tsa ngwana, le tsala ya Modimo ya bana, yo o mo mathateng a gagwe a neng a mo ikanya, a bonala a tsaya ngwana wa gagwe mo diatleng tsa gagwe, fa a tsaya ngwana yo o tsofetseng, a bo a mo itumedisa.

mg: Nandalo izany fotoana izany, ary nandry teo an-tratrany i Lucie kely. Avy eo, tao anatin'ny akon'ny fikotroko, dia nisy ny dian'ny tongony kely sy ny feon'ny teniny mipoapoaka. Avelao ny akon'izy ireo, afaka mandre foana ireo olona ho avy ilay reny tanora teo amin'ny sisin'ny fandriana. Tonga izy ireo, ary nibaliaka ny masoandro ny trano maizina noho ny fihomehezan'ny zaza iray, ary ilay naman'Andriamanitra ny ankizy, izay namboraka taminy tao anatin'ny fahoriany, dia toa nitrotro ny zanany teo an-tsandriny, raha nandray ny zaza fahiny Izy ka nanao izany ho fifaliana masina ho azy.

en: Seven prisoners released, seven gory heads on pikes, the keys of the accursed fortress of the eight strong towers, some discovered letters and other memorials of prisoners of old time, long dead of broken hearts,â€”such, and suchâ€”like, the loudly echoing footsteps of Saint Antoine escort through the Paris streets in mid-July, one thousand seven hundred and eighty-nine. Now, Heaven defeat the fancy of Lucie Darnay, and keep these feet far out of her life! For, they are headlong, mad, and dangerous; and in the years so long after the breaking of the cask at Defargeâ€™s wine-shop door, they are not easily purified when once stained red.

st: BatÅ¡oaruoa ba supileng ba ile ba lokolloa, lihlooho tse supileng tsa gory pikes, linotlolo tsa qhobosheane e rohakiloeng tsa litora tse robeli tse matla, tse ling li ile tsa sibolla mangolo le likhopotso tse ling tsa batÅ¡oaruoa ba nako ea khale, ba shoeleng lipelo tse robehileng, hape e le mokhoa o joalo hape oa ho nahana, mehato e phahameng ea Mohalaleli Antoine ea mo felehetseng literateng tsa Paris bohareng ba Phupu, sekete le makholo a supileng le mashome a robeli a metso e robong. Joale, Leholimo le hlola se majabajaba sa Lucie Darnay, 'me u boloke maoto ana hole le bophelo ba hae! bakeng sa, li hlooho-long, li hlanya ebile li kotsi; 'Me ka lilemo tse telele haholo ka mor'a ho pshatloa ha lemati la veine defarge, ha ho bonolo ho hloekisa hanngoe stained khubelu.

tn: Bagolegwa ba supa ba ne ba gololwa, ditlhogo di le supa tse di neng di le mo diphupung, dilotlolo tsa phemelo ya phemelo e e nang le maatla a le robedi, bangwe ba ne ba bona makwalo le dipologo tse dingwe tsa bagolegwa ba nako e telele, ba ba suleng dipelo tse di thubegileng, le tse di ntseng jalo,+ tse di jaaka e kete, e bile e le tsela e e kwa godimo ya Saint Antoine e e tsamayang mo mebileng ya Paris mo bogareng jwa Phukwi, sekete makgolo a supa le masome a supa le borobabobedi le masome a supa le borobabobedi. 10-10 Jwale, Lehodimo le hlola Lusifa ya Lucie Darnay, mme o boloke maoto a hae hole le bophelo ba hae! 18Gonne ba a bo ba le bogale, ba a gapa, ba a tena; Mo dingwageng di le dintsi morago ga go thubega ga go na sepe se se sweufaditsweng se se neng se le mo go sone, se se ka se phepafadiwe ka bonako fa e le sehibidu se se sweufaditsweng.

mg: Gadra fito no navotsotra, fito gory loha amin'ny pikes, ny fanalahidin'ny manda voaozonan'ireo tilikambo valo matanjaka, ny sasany nahita taratasy sy fahatsiarovana hafa an'ireo gadra fahiny, maty noho ny ratram-po hatry ny ela, toy izany, sy ny sisaâ€”toy ny hoe ny dian-tongotr'i Saint Antoine manakoako mafy mamakivaky ny araben'i Paris tamin'ny tapaky ny volana Jolay, sivy amby valopolo sy fitonjato sy arivo. Ankehitriny, resin'ny lanitra ny fanirian'i Lucie Darnay, ary mitazona ireo tongotra ireo ho lavitra ny fiainany! Fa lava loha, adala ary mampidi-doza izy ireo; ary tao anatin'ny taona maro taorian'ny namakiana ny siny tao amin'ny varavaran'ny toeram-pisotroana divay ao Defarge, dia tsy mora ny manadio azy ireo rehefa mena indray mandeha.

en: As the rider rattled down the hill again and through the street, the village was illuminating. The mender of roads, and the two hundred and fifty particular friends, inspired as one man and woman by the idea of lighting up, had darted into their houses, and were putting candles in every dull little pane of glass. The general scarcity of everything, occasioned candles to be borrowed in a rather peremptory manner of Monsieur Gabelle; and in a moment of reluctance and hesitation on that functionaryâ€™s part, the mender of roads, once so submissive to authority, had remarked that carriages were good to make bonfires with, and that post-horses would roast.

en: He knew very well, that in his horror of the deed which had culminated the bad deeds and bad reputation of the old family house, in his resentful suspicions of his uncle, and in the aversion with which his conscience regarded the crumbling fabric that he was supposed to uphold, he had acted imperfectly. He knew very well, that in his love for Lucie, his renunciation of his social place, though by no means new to his own mind, had been hurried and incomplete. He knew that he ought to have systematically worked it out and supervised it, and that he had meant to do it, and that it had never been done.

en: A very few French leagues of his journey were accomplished, when Charles Darnay began to perceive that for him along these country roads there was no hope of return until he should have been declared a good citizen at Paris. Whatever might befall now, he must on to his journeyâ€™s end. Not a mean village closed upon him, not a common barrier dropped across the road behind him, but he knew it to be another iron door in the series that was barred between him and England. The universal watchfulness so encompassed him, that if he had been taken in a net, or were being forwarded to his destination in a cage, he could not have felt his freedom more completely gone.

en: He left escort and escorted without saying a word, however, and went into the guard-room; meanwhile, they sat upon their horses outside the gate. Looking about him while in this state of suspense, Charles Darnay observed that the gate was held by a mixed guard of soldiers and patriots, the latter far outnumbering the former; and that while ingress into the city for peasantsâ€™ carts bringing in supplies, and for similar traffic and traffickers, was easy enough, egress, even for the homeliest people, was very difficult. A numerous medley of men and women, not to mention beasts and vehicles of various sorts, was waiting to issue forth; but, the previous identification was so strict, that they filtered through the barrier very slowly. Some of these people knew their turn for examination to be so far off, that they lay down on the ground to sleep or smoke, while others talked together, or loitered about. The red cap and tri-colour cockade were universal, both among men and women.

tn: O ne a tsamaya a bo a tsamaya a sa bue sepe, mme a ya kwa ntlwaneng ya motlhokomedi. Ba ne ba ntse ba palama dipitse tsa bone kwa ntle ga kgoro. Fa Charles Darna a mo lebile, charles Darnay o ne a lemoga gore kgoro e ne e tshwerwe ke balebedi ba ba tswang kwa go ba ba neng ba na le masole le bajanala, ba ne ba le kgakala le batho ba ba neng ba le mo go yone. Le fa go ntse jalo, fa ba ne ba tsena mo motseng ka dikoloi tsa balemi ba ba tlisang dithoto, mme go ne go le bonolo go gaisa, le fa go ne go le bonolo go gaisa batho ba ba nang le magae, go ne go le thata. Go ne go na le mefuta e e farologaneng ya banna le basadi, e seng go bua ka diphologolo le dikoloi tsa mefuta e e farologaneng, di ne di emetse go ntsha; Le fa go ntse jalo, go ne go le thata go lemoga gore ba ne ba isiwa kwa tlase ka bonya. Bangwe ba bone ba ne ba itse gore go tlhotlhomisiwa ga bone go le kgakala, mo ba neng ba robetse kgotsa ba goga, ba bangwe ba ne ba bua mmogo kgotsa ba ne ba bua ka ga bone. Letlalo le lehibidu le le pinki e ne e le bophara, magareng ga banna le basadi.

mg: Ary nony niala teo izy, dia nanaraka azy ka tsy niteny na dia teny indraim-bava akory aza, dia niditra tao amin'ny efi-trano fiambenana; Ary izy ireo dia nipetraka tamin'ny soavaliny teo ivelan'ny vavahady. Rehefa nijery azy i Charles Darnay raha mbola tao anatin'izany toe-javatra izany, dia nahatsikaritra fa ny vavahady dia notanan'ny mpiambina miaramila sy tia tanindrazana mifangaro, ary ity farany dia nihoatra lavitra noho ny teo aloha; Ary raha toa ka mora ny miditra ao an-tanÃ na ho an'ny sarety entin'ny tantsaha, sy ho an'ireo mpivarotra sy mpivarotra mitovy amin'izany, dia tena sarotra ny Ekroress, na dia ho an'ireo olona manana ny maha-izy azy aza. Maro ireo lehilahy sy vehivavy, tsy lazaina intsony ny biby sy ny fiara isan-karazany, no niandry ny hamoaka izany; Saingy, tena henjana ny famantarana teo aloha, ka dia nosivanin'izy ireo tsikelikely tao anatin'ilay sakana. Ny sasany tamin'ireo olona ireo dia nahafantatra fa lavitra loatra ny fotoana hanaovana ny fanadinana, ka nandry teo amin'ny tany izy ireo mba hatory na hifoka, raha ny hafa kosa niara-niresaka, na nitebiteby. Ny saron-tava mena sy ny cockade loko telo dia manerana izao tontolo izao, na eo amin'ny lehilahy na eo amin'ny vehivavy.

en: So strangely clouded were these refinements by the prison manners and gloom, so spectral did they become in the inappropriate squalor and misery through which they were seen, that Charles Darnay seemed to stand in a company of the dead. Ghosts all! The ghost of beauty, the ghost of stateliness, the ghost of elegance, the ghost of pride, the ghost of frivolity, the ghost of wit, the ghost of youth, the ghost of age, all waiting their dismissal from the desolate shore, all turning on him eyes that were changed by the death they had died in coming there.

en: But, it beckoned him back in his sleep, and showed itself in shining forms. Free and happy, back in the old house in Soho (though it had nothing in it like the real house), unaccountably released and light of heart, he was with Lucie again, and she told him it was all a dream, and he had never gone away. A pause of forgetfulness, and then he had even suffered, and had come back to her, dead and at peace, and yet there was no difference in him. Another pause of oblivion, and he awoke in the sombre morning, unconscious where he was or what had happened, until it flashed upon his mind, â€œthis is the day of my death!â€
